result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome A Wheeler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  All court costs and GPS & DNA surcharges waived.
Civil filing fee of $204.50 pursuant to sec 814.61(1)(d) & (e) & service fee pursuant to sec 814.70(1) from case 20CV2218 waived.
